import pandas as pd
from sklearn.preprocessing import StandardScaler

# ***** DO NOT EDIT LINES BELOW *****
# These lines may be overwritten if component details or inputs/outputs change.
COMPONENT_INFO = {
    "inputs": {
        "data": {"data_type": "ANY"},
    },
    "outputs": {
        "scaled": {"data_type": "ANY"},
    },
    "name": "Standard Scale",
    "category": "Statistic",
    "description": "Applies Standard Scaling",
    "version_tag": "1.0.0",
    "id": "6c4ce4d5-e73f-210e-48a8-230c8e5088ef",
    "revision_group_id": "6c4ce4d5-e73f-210e-48a8-230c8e5088ef",

    "released_timestamp": "2022-02-09T17:33:32.974755+00:00",
}

from hdutils import parse_default_value  # noqa: E402, F401


def main(*, data):
    # entrypoint function for this component
    # ***** DO NOT EDIT LINES ABOVE *****
    # write your function code here.

    input_data = data if isinstance(data, pd.DataFrame) else data.to_frame()

    scaler = (
        StandardScaler()
    )  # Skalierung an Mittelwert und Standard-Abweichung (z-score)
    scaled = pd.DataFrame(
        scaler.fit_transform(input_data),
        columns=input_data.columns,
        index=input_data.index,
    )

    return {"scaled": scaled if isinstance(data, pd.DataFrame) else scaled.squeeze()}
